page.title: 13A Dockland Visit (Part 2)
page.content: {The Headland-H/pool By Nicola Parvin {and By Christopher Hill On our visit to H/pool Docks we walked along a dirt road to the Life-boat cabin to see the Life-boat,which is a plastic dinghy with an outboard motor. The Lifeboat is called "Friendship 3". On our visit we saw two,tugs and their names were 'Hart'and'Stranton'.They were built in Devon in 1958 and are both called after districts of H/pool. H/pool Docks import cars,timber,paper and grain and export scrap metal.Next we went to see the dredger to find out how it works.It works by sucking silt off the bottom of the sea.A man showed us some of the{marine life}that the dredger sucked up off the bottom.On the way back to the school we saw another Life-boat called{The Scout.}
